@graph.caption: Cute mummy cookies frosted with stripes and decorated with two candy eyes.

@graph.name: Mummy Cookies - Eating Bird Food
@graph.description: Healthy soft pumpkin cookies decorated with frosting and candy eyes to make spooky mummy cookies. So cute and perfect for Halloween.

@graph.name: Brittany Mullins
@graph.description: meet brittany Hey there, I’m Brittany, the creator of Eating Bird Food, holistic nutritionist, health coach and personal trainer. Whether it’s for my meal plans, my favorite recipes or just because you want to feel good, I’m so happy you’re here.

@graph.name: Mummy Cookies
@graph.description: Healthy soft pumpkin cookies decorated with frosting and candy eyes to make spooky mummy cookies. So cute and perfect for Halloween.

video.name: Mummy Pumpkin Cookies
video.description: Healthy soft pumpkin cookies decorated with frosting and candy eyes to make spooky mummy cookies. So cute and perfect for Halloween.

recipeIngredient: 1/3 cup mini chocolate chips (I used Enjoy Life)

recipeInstructions.text: Prep: Preheat oven to 350°F and line a baking sheet with parchment.
recipeInstructions.name: Prep: Preheat oven to 350°F and line a baking sheet with parchment.

recipeInstructions.text: Mix dry ingredients: Stir together dry ingredients (flours, pumpkin pie spice, baking soda and sea salt) in a mixing bowl.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix dry ingredients: Stir together dry ingredients (flours, pumpkin pie spice, baking soda and sea salt) in a mixing bowl.

recipeInstructions.text: Mix wet ingredients: Mix together wet ingredients (eggs, pumpkin, sugar and vanilla) in a separate mixing bowl.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix wet ingredients: Mix together wet ingredients (eggs, pumpkin, sugar and vanilla) in a separate mixing bowl.

recipeInstructions.text: Combine: Combine wet and dry ingredients. The dough will seem really wet for a cookie dough. This is ideal!
recipeInstructions.name: Combine: Combine wet and dry ingredients. The dough will seem really wet for a cookie dough. This is ideal!

recipeInstructions.text: Add chocolate chips: Stir in 1/3 cup chocolate chips.
recipeInstructions.name: Add chocolate chips: Stir in 1/3 cup chocolate chips.

recipeInstructions.text: Scoop: Use a medium cookie scoop to scoop and place cookies on prepared cookie sheet. Press cookie dough down into a cookie shape with a spoon or your fingers. Cookies won’t spread very much so you can space them about 1 inch apart.
recipeInstructions.name: Scoop: Use a medium cookie scoop to scoop and place cookies on prepared cookie sheet. Press cookie dough down into a cookie shape with a spoon or your fingers. Cookies won’t spread very much so you can space them about 1 inch apart.

recipeInstructions.text: Cool: Move cookies to a wire rack and cool completely.
recipeInstructions.name: Cool: Move cookies to a wire rack and cool completely.

recipeInstructions.text: Decorate with frosting: add frosting to the piping bag fitted with a #44 or #45 tip and pipe the frosting across each cookie, one at a time. Use different angles and overlap some of the lines until most of the cookie is covered. Place a tiny bit of frosting on the back of two candy eyeballs and attach them just above the center of each cookie.
recipeInstructions.name: Decorate with frosting: add frosting to the piping bag fitted with a #44 or #45 tip and pipe the frosting across each cookie, one at a time. Use different angles and overlap some of the lines until most of the cookie is covered. Place a tiny bit of frosting on the back of two candy eyeballs and attach them just above the center of each cookie.

recipeInstructions.text: To store: store leftover cookies in a container in the fridge for up to one week.
recipeInstructions.name: To store: store leftover cookies in a container in the fridge for up to one week.
